Description: Part of a black granite sundial, consisting of a square gnomon with a flat top, decorated with relief carving showing the doors of a shrine on one side and a figure of Ra-Horakhty on another. The remaining two sides are plain. The scenes are accompanied by hieroglyphic texts, and a separate inscription runs around three sides at the base, naming a priest Ahmose. The sloping part of the object, once attached at the base, is missing.
Bibliographic references: Lippincott 1999 / The Story of Time (p.108, cat.100)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 1 Dec-2000 24 Sep, London, The Queen’s House, The Story of Time
Condition: Good. Incomplete, all the sloping section missing.
